utterance.speaker: Transcribed
utterance.content: Rahul

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: I can't do this... button.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Almost got it.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: The sound... of the people talking.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: That's A-flat, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: All set.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: My hand. Hurts.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Oh, papa!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's the emergency?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Thirty-five-year-old savant, dystonia in his left hand.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He page us at five in the morning for that? I'm going back to bed. Dystonia's not life-threatening. Clonazepam will take care of tha...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's already on Clonazepam. Or seizures he has from a bus accident when he was ten.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Then we treat with Benztropine.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's up?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Thirty-five-year-old savant, dystonia.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm going back to bed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where you going?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Bathroom. It can wait.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There is no case, House. Even if dystonia was some big medical mystery, it's not this time.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're not intrigued as to how a perfectly healthy ten-year-old boy, with no prior musical training, gets into an accident on his way to school...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ...and suddenly starts playing piano?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Do we have to start a twenty-five-year-old case before breakfast?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You two shower together?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Double negative. It's a yes.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Savantism is just one of those things. It's... inexplicable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Just because it's "inexplicted", doesn't mean it's inexplicable. I want new labs. CBC with platelets, chem panel, thyroid and adrenal function tests.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Raise your left hand.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's your right hand.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Just wanna make sure whatever happened doesn't happen again. Push up.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Push up.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: That's good. Shows he's engaged.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Spine's okay. Alright, stick out your tongue like this. Copy me.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: You have a big tongue.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I know it's funny, but copy me.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: There was construction on Radcliffe, so I had to get out of the car and-and walk in high-heels for over a mile.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Radcliffe? What was the cross street?

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Does it matter?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know. You're the one who brought it up. Tie this off.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nice and tight.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: Does this have anything to do with my foot?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You have a blister. You don't waste a doctor's time with a blister. Waste a doctor's time with more important things like the sewer that's beng vented out of your mouth.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: My breath?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: If you could stop doing that, we'd all be grateful.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I can't stop breathing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Nope! But you can stop puking.

utterance.speaker: PATIENT
utterance.content: I don't...!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your lips say no, your gnarly fingers say --

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's good to go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's a shame. You look cute that thin.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Motor cortex looks good. Everything checks out.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What tests did you run?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Full battery of neurological...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I need this blood checked for cholesterol and glucose levels.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Patient had a foot problem.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Different patient.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: There's no one else in here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're using the wrong equipment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm Dr. House. On the off-chance that Dr. Foreman didn't mention it, I have something of a gift too. C'mon.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your turn.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: My turn.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It might. Okay, Patrick. Close your eyes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: D, G-flat, A-flat, B...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah, all right, all right.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's good. Can we let him go?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's great. He's staying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Call radiology. I need a Functional MRI of his brain.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: FMRI's not gonna show trauma.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not looking for trauma. I wanna see the music.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: The music.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, that's dull.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Think fMRI's gonna show a big arrow pointing to a flashing sign saying "Savantism"?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Would be hugely helpful. Somehow he got rewired as a music specialist. I wanna know how that happens.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He had access to parts of his brain that you don't.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: His brains doing nothing. Looks like any jerk listening.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's not savant at listening. He's a savant at playing. Both listening and playing are different neurological processes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Turn off the music.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Patrick, I want you to pretend that your leg is a piano.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: But it's not a piano.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know. That's why I said "pretend". Kid's a moron. Keep your head still, use your fingers.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Cool, huh? His heart rate rose.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Emotional response?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Then why is there no activity in the limbic system? Unless there's a problem in his heart. Do an echo to confirm. And scrub up. He's gonna need surgery.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wasn't dystonia. He's got a heart condition that caused the arteries in his arm to constrict.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Do you have any idea why House would wanna go to Boston?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: The chowder?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Plane tickets, this Friday. I opened his mail. I heard there's an opening at Harvard for division chief, Infectious Disease.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Ambition's not one of his more prominent traits.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Although...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He was testing blood in the clinic. Don't think it was the patient's blood.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why? It was green?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No, he was checking for routine stuff.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Makes sense if he's checking for basic medical clearance for employment.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm going home.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No, you're not.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He could show up any minute.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Not with a savant to obsess about.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I'll take in here. Bedroom's down the hall.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You've been here?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Where else would the bedroom be?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Come with?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You're scared of him catching us breaking into his home, but you're not scared of him catching us doing it in his bed?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm gonna get fired anyway.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Almost at the heart. ____. Aaand... done.

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Heart rate's one-sixty! It's accelerating. He's at two-ten!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Supraventricular tachycardia. Paddles!

utterance.speaker: NURSE
utterance.content: Charging!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're wasting our time!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: His high-school yearbook.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Unless you think he's going to Boston to attend a high-school reunion, put it back and let's get out of here before he comes home.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He's not smiling.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I wonder if he has teeth.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's the area code for Boston?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Six-one-seven. Why?

utterance.speaker: VOICE
utterance.content: Massachusetts General. May I help you?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Did you think you could steal Dr. House without a fight?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Quit jerking me around. I know he's coming out there.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He's called you six times in the last month!

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You think if you keep repeating it, I'll start believing you?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: If he's not coming there for a job interview, he's either coming to your hospital for a social visit or because he's a patient.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Is it a social visit, Dr. Medick?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: What's up?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: D'you know Dr. Kupersmithin Boston?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah, he's an oncologist. What's up?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What's his sub-specialty?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Brain cancer. What's going on?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He doesn't look sick. He should have symptoms. Blurred vision, headaches, confusion, clumsiness...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Depends on how far along the cancer is. What kind, how agressive?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: He didn't tell you?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House is House.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: He's no different than anyone else with cancer. Once you tell, then every conversation is about that.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Cardiac arrest means we were wrong.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: It was a heart problem.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But no vasoconstriction. The heart problem couldn't have caused the hand problem.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Unless the bleed happened suddenly. Less blood to the brain explains dystonia. Less blood to the heart explains the heart attack. Scope him both above and below. If that doesn't work, gut him.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's a risk his throat could collapse.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: You look mad, papa.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Hurt me? Why hurt me?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: What's wrong with me?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: All right, here we go, Patrick.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: You won't hurt me?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Okay, open. Like this.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Wilson! Just spoke to Cuddy. She can't confirm whether House is applying for a job at Boston.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Yeah. I-I'm late for a...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If I have to look for work, I have a right to know.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Pretty.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wrote this when I was in junior high school. Could never figure out what came next. And Dimwit came up with this.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's good.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's perfect.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I could set up a tower on the roof during a lightning storm. Help you switch brains with your patient. Then you would be the brilliant pianist and he would be the doctor hiding brain cancer from his friend.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's nothing.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You need to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You need to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: At least, let me look at your medical file.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're making a big deal out of nothing. Who else knows?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No one. And cancer isn't nothing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sorry, didn't mean to offend your specialty.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Why didn't you come to me?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stein's good.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Stein's in Africa for the next six months.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's given me at least six months. Go to Boston, get the treatment. Everything will be fine. No need to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You're right. Surgeon found a bleed behind the kidney and the retroperitoneal cavity, but no reason for it. No cancer, no ruptured arteries.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: So bleeding explains the symptoms, but we've got no explanation for the bleeding.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: And while they were closing him up, Patrick had a grand mal seizure... which makes no sense, since he's on an anti-convulsive medication.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You told him.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: No, I didn't.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: I... only told Cameron.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hey! Okay. You guys have cleverly deduced that I have cancer. You have no right to know. You have no business knowing.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We'd like to run some blood tests...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: As soon as you work up our patient, who is not me.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Just wanna make sure you weren't misdiagnosed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I wasn't. Let's move on.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We're just asking for a couple of vials.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Okay, we're going to proceed as if I'm perfectly healthy.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: How can we do that if we know you're not?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You don't know anything! Except, hopefully, our patient on anti-convulsive medication has a seizure.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Anti-seizure meds don't prevent seizures, they just make them manageable.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: According to the surgeon's report, this one wasn't even close to manageable.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Means the question isn't why is he having seizures, it's why are his seizures getting worse?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What's changed?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: His brain, it's gotten worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Why don't we make it even worser?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We take him off anti-convulsive medication.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: He'll seize even more. Multiple seizures can seriously damage a brain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Dude can't button a shirt. How much more damage are we really talking about?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Strongest seizures will light up different parts of the brain, which will indicate response to damage.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Once he gets worse, do a PET scan.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: PET scan done?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You come for my feelings?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Cause I left them in my other pants.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: This is a letter of recommendation. I'm applying for a job at Penn.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thank you for writing your own. Sure my thoughts are beautifully phrased.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Thank you for signing it. Saves me from having to fake your signature.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stay away from Weiss. He cries with his patients. Holds their hands as they die. He won't like you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your new-found nonchalance in the face of cancer.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: I thought you'd find it appealing.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Twenty seconds. Pretty good.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Time it took you to go from hard-ass to human being.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You really wanna leave?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: If you're not here, there's not much point of staying.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not dead yet.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What're you doing?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I know this must be a turn-on for you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: A little whorish to kiss and stab.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You kissed back.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't want you to die without knowing the feeling. Actually, no woman should die without knowing the feeling.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: All I need is a few drops of your blood.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Foreman and Chase's lips are not gonna get to close, now that I know your plan.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: There's a nurse downstairs about to risk his job to steal the blood you drew from yourself yesterday.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm Patient Number Oh-Two-Oh-Four-Oh-Six, in the Record Room, under the name Luke N. Laura! There's a whole file of blood there, along with CT scans, MRIs, CSF, everything you need.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You need a sperm sample, come back without the needle.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Six-centimetre mass in his dorsal midbrain, extending into the temporal lobe. That's inoperable.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: What kind of time does he have?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's got a year.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Here's a consent from Boston, for the cancer drug trial.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Any description of the process for previous trials?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Any chance it'll work?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. It's not even designed to work.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Why? What're you...?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's designed to treat depression in terminal cancer patients.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: He doesn't seem depressed.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hah! Okay, let's assume that I am dying. Which I specifically told you not to assume -- . Can we at least assume that I'm not dying tomorrow? Whereas this kid...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: PET reveals several more hotspots. But they're non-specific...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: How can you focus on him?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'S the only way I can cope. PET also showed the left brain is working hard...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Harder than the right?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Wouldn't be worth mentioning otherwise.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Bleeding in the brain. Blood would irritate the lining, might cause the seizures to get worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes! He needs an angiogram to look at the vasculature inside his brain.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We'll get right on it as soon as we're finished here.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Don't get up. I got it. You're busy. Continue.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know what my team is doing right now?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Trying to figure what's wrong with me.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: What's wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Thanks for asking. They found out that I'm dying.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: That's sad.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everyone's dying.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: That's sad.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Meteor lands on my head tomorrow, it's all academic. I told them to leave me alone. But did they?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Did they?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, that one was rhetorical.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, they did not.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Who the hell were you before you hit your head?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: "Hell" is a bad word.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So is "ass", "bitch".

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I can probably rattle off fifty much more complicated disgusting ones, but then your dad would get pissed at me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Like your life?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: What life?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your life. Like the piano? Going on tours. Scoring girls left and right.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: I don't like girls.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Boys. Whatever gets you off.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: I like the piano.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Dr. Peter Hayes, this is Eric Foreman at Princeton-Plainsborough. You were doing the signal transduction-inhibitor clinical trial. What kind of results did you...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Transduction-inhibitors are a decade away.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Hi, Pete!

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Got another trial going on at Duke. Fifteen percent extend their lives beyond five years. If you're positive for Protein PHF...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Stop... trying to save me. I'm fine. MRA confirms smalls collections of blood throughout the white matter of Patrick's right hemisphere. Mind if we chat about that for a few moments?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Either trauma, an aneurysm, cancer or autoimmune disease.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We need a biopsy to figure out which it is.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: EEG was non-specific. Where you gonna biopsy?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Everywhere!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sssure. Just put on a blindfold and play "Pin-The-Tail-On-The-Brain".

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's bleeding into his brain. He's dying.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You can't just randomly stab the temporal lobe and hope to hit the right spot.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm only gonna take little tiny pieces.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: 'Til what?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: 'Til I find the problem.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Or you kill him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, I'll keep going even if I kill him. Then he's screwed. Thanks for the chat.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What if... we do the EEG from inside his brain?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm actually little insulted. You were supposed to spend the last hour worried about me.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: It's risky and invasive.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But that's why God invented the long consent form. Can you get to why this is a brilliant idea?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: External EEG could get confused if there are multiple structural abnormalities. If we perform the EEG inside the skull, it could show us where to biopsy.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Brilliant. Go. Do.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'd also like to talk to you about...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: This is gonna get personal, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We'll use a small drill to get inside his skull...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yes. Once we have twelve holes, we'll surgically implant electrodes under the mengenies against the brain.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: And it's either cancer or autoimmune disease.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Neither.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Where do we cut?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We don't. I need to say something.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Something personal?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I can't leave because you got something interesting in that file.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're an arrogant ass..., who makes it impossible for anyone to like him, by punching people who don't deserve...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Can we get to the "but" part of this speech?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: But I like you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, you don't. You're just reacting to the perception of my death. You need to put things in order. Fear of guilt...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Will you shut up?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: See? I annoy you. Now are you gonna give me the results or are we gonna...

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Inter-cranial EEG showed no electrical abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Which means it's autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: No. Also showed his entire right hemisphere is brain-dead.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So, while you guys were worried about me, half of this kid's brain died. The only solace you should take from this is the fact that... it didn't. Garden-variety EEG sucks compared to the in-brain variety, which is not gonna miss brain death.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's gotten worse.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not that much worse.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Respiration is depressed. Seizures are increasing, one every five minutes.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not that much worse. He can still talk. He's left-handed, which means his speech is in the right side.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You don't know how Patrick's brain reorganized itself twenty-five years ago?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: What if the right side... is just a little dead. Maybe he has random neurons firing.

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You're just looking for a puzzle to distract you from your own situation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're right. He's dead. Let's go home.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: I'm so sor...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: A piano.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's this?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: He's obviously lost the use of his...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Music is a global process. Can't play the piano with half a brain.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: What's it mean?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Means the right side of his brain has always sucked. Means it's not relevant what's going on now.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: Wow, then it's autoimmune.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah! Question is, what do we do about it?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: 'S likely ones we can fix. Polyarteritis nodosa, Takayasu or sarcoid. I'll start treatment.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not what I was talking about. But yeah, you do that.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Your turn?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Do you have to do that?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You mean, cheapen everyone's attempt at a human moment by identifying the real calculations that go into it?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Yeeah.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yeah! I do.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I'm sorry you're dying. I'm gonna hug you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Anything to say?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Well, if you're considering grabbing my ass, don't start anything...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: ... you can't finish.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: As long as we're just standing here, you mind if we work? How's the kid's treatment going?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Are you crying?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: No. Respiration rate's up. Seizures are coming down. 'S all good.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not for what I'm gonna do next.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: But there is no next. He's gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Only if he wants to remain a four-year-old who wets his bed.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: There's nothing else for him.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: There's better. Thanks for the hug.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: It's the middle of the night. You know I'd be asleep.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Phone would have woken you up just as much. I can see what you're wearing on the phone.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My patient with the fifty-five IQ has Takayasu syndrome. Very uncommon. Happens mostly in Asian women.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Takayasu is manageable with steroids, which you already know. So, I assume you're here for something else.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: My patient also has a significant seizure problem.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Also manageable with anticonvulsive medication.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Yes. He kept taking his anticonvulsive medication, he could go back on tour and play the piano.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But... a hemispherectomy would completely stop the right-brain seizure activity and he would no longer need to take his anticonvulsive medication.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You want to remove half his brain?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The right half. It'd be irresponsible to remove the left.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: You don't remove half a brain and gain function.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not my brain. But his, who knows? What? Lets say I'm the left side of Patrick's brain, I'm quick- witted, I'm charming, I'm great looking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You're the right side of his brain. You're useless, old, damaged.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We go to a bar for a drink. Now, I have the mad skills to be scoring all the hot babes, but instead, I'm spending my time wiping drool off your chin and making sure you don't eat the tablecloth.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: What's the father wanna do?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: So go wake him up.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: House, I'm so sorry.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Forgot I was dying, huh?

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: I'm here, if you need me.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I need you.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: One small feel for man. One giant ass for mankind.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Thanks. Good luck in Boston.

utterance.speaker: CUDDY
utterance.content: Call the "Make-A-Wish" Foundation.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I think we should we should remove the right side of your son's brain.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Does he look fixed? Right side of his brain is keeping him walking straight. Other than that, it's been dead-weight ever since the accident. 'F we remove it, seizures would stop completely.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: But without the seizures, the left side would have a chance to actually function. He'll learn to do new things. Only bummer, he'll never play the piano again.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not saying he'd ever work for NASA, but flipping burgers isn't out of the question.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: No, you're actually lucky. You don't have to watch your kid grow up, you don't have to let go.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He's a monkey-grinder at the circus.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: So has the monkey. The piano is a neurological accident.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: And I'm offering him a life.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It's up to you.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: I've isolated the cancer proteins in House's CSF.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: About time. Can't let him go to Boston if he qualifies for the Duke trial.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: You wanna do it?

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: Damn. He's negative for Protein PHF. He doesn't qualify.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: That shouldn't be there.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Oh, papa.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: Are you happy?

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: House! Open up! Open up! It's important!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I got a flight in three hours.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You don't have cancer. There was an abnormal presence of IgC and IgM indicating...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I don't have neurosyphilis. My MRI showed nothing...

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: It's a gumma in your brain. It's very rare not to be in the liver and I'm really glad we never slept together, but...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: We would have used a condom and I don't have syphilis. My VDRL was negative...

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: We did an FDA antibody test. The VDRL was a false negative. You're not going to die! All you need is IV antibiotics!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Did you send these results to Mass General?

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You... idiots.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: We just told you you're not gonna die. You should be making out with Cameron!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You knew it wasn't cancer?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I was sure it was cancer.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Then why aren't you celebrating?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... it wasn't my damn file!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You faked cancer?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: The real patient is in the Witherspoon Wing. Feel free to tell his wife he's not gonna die, but he is cheating on her.

utterance.speaker: CHASE
utterance.content: Why would you want us to think you...?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't!! I wanted the guys at Boston to think that I had cancer. I wanted the guys, who were gonna implant a cool drug right into pleasure centre of my brain, to think that I had cancer!

utterance.speaker: CAMERON
utterance.content: You faked cancer to get high?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm going to bed.

utterance.speaker: FOREMAN
utterance.content: You're right! I don't like you!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Sure. Now that I'm not dying.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Heard Patrick's hemispherectomy went well.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: He survived the surgery. He's unconscious, but...

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: How depressed are you?!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm not depressed.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You faked... cancer.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It was an outpatient procedure. I was curious.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Are you curious about heroin?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Not since last year's Christmas party. Whoof! I know this goes against your nature, but can we not make too much of this?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: You made people think that you were going to die!

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I didn't make them! I tried to hide it! You idiots needed to get into my business.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm sure I'll regret asking, but why are you laughing?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: It's ironic.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: I'm sure I'll regret asking, but why...?

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Depression in cancer patients. 'S not as common as you think. It's not the dying that gets to people. It's the dying alone. The patients with family, with friends... they tend to do okay. You don't have cancer. You do have people who give a damn. So what do you do? You fake the cancer, then push the people who care away.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Because... they're boring. Go home to your hotel room and laugh at that irony.

utterance.speaker: WILSON
utterance.content: Start small, House. Take a chance. Maybe something that doesn't involve sticking stuff in your brain. Pizza with a friend. A movie. Something.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Follow my finger.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: You know your name?

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Speech centre was on the right side. It'll be a while before he's talking.

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: It'll take some time to...

utterance.speaker: HOUSE
utterance.content: Looks happy.
